perturbation.original_text: 1.1 Grant of License. Licensor on behalf of itself and its Affliates hereby grants to Licensee the limited licenses to use and have used the Licensed Mark: (i) for the Licensed Products as set forth on Schedule 2; and (ii) as set forth on Schedule 1, concerning agreements entered into by Licensee prior to the Effective Date ("Existing Agreements"). For the avoidance of doubt, Licensor also grants to Licensee and its subsidiaries and affiliates a non-exclusive, worldwide royalty-free license for continued use of the Licensed Mark for the production and sale of inventory containing the Licensed Mark applied to such products during the Transition Period as set forth in section 8.2 of the Separation and Distribution Agreement and in Schedule 2 of this Agreement. Licensee will not, however, use the Licensed Mark except for the production and sale of inventory as provided in this Section 1.1 and in Section 8.2 of the Separation and Distribution Agreement and Schedule 2 of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 Grant of License. Arconic on behalf of itself and its Affliates hereby grants to Arconic Rolled Products the limited permissions to use and have used the Licensed Mark: (i) for the Licensed Products as set forth on Schedule 2; and (ii) as set forth on Schedule 1, concerning agreements entered into by Arconic Rolled Products prior to the Effective Date (“Existing Agreements”). For the avoidance of doubt, Arconic also grants to Arconic Rolled Products and its subsidiaries and affiliates a non-exclusive, worldwide royalty-free permission for continued use of the Licensed Mark for the production and sale of inventory containing the Licensed Mark applied to such products during the Transition Period as set forth in section 8.2 of the Separation and Distribution Agreement and in Schedule 2 of this Agreement. Arconic Rolled Products will not, however, use the Licensed Mark except for the production and sale of inventory as provided in this Section 1.1 and in Section 8.2 of the Separation and Distribution Agreement and Schedule 2 of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'license' and 'permission' are used interchangeably, creating confusion about the legal weight and scope of the rights granted. It is unclear whether 'permission' provides the same level of protection and enforceability as a 'license'. Also, Licensor and Licensee are renamed to Arconic and Arconic Rolled Products respectively.

perturbation.original_text: 1.5 Quality Control, Licensor Approvals. Licensor, as owner of the Licensed Mark, shall have the right at all times to control and approve the nature and quality of the Licensed Products (and the Licensed Mark thereon), and to inspect Licensee's business operations upon reasonable prior notice for the purpose of ensuring that a high level of quality of the Licensed Products is being maintained by Licensee. At Licensor's reasonable request during each calendar year, Licensee shall submit samples to Licensor, at no cost to Licensor, and shall not materially depart therefrom without Licensor's prior express written consent. The Licensed Products, as well as all promotional, packaging and advertising material relative thereto, shall include all appropriate legal notices as required by Licensor.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.5 Quality Control, Arconic Approvals. Licensor, as owner of the Licensed Mark, shall have the discretion at all times to oversee and sanction the nature and quality of the Licensed Products (and the Licensed Mark thereon), and to audit Licensee's business operations upon reasonable prior notice for the purpose of ensuring that a high level of quality of the Licensed Products is being maintained by Licensee. At Licensor's reasonable request during each calendar year, Licensee shall submit samples to Licensor, at no cost to Licensor, and shall not materially depart therefrom without Arconic's prior express written sanction. The Licensed Products, as well as all promotional, packaging and advertising material relative thereto, shall include all appropriate legal notices as required by Arconic.
perturbation.explanation: The word 'right' is replaced with 'discretion', and 'approve' is replaced with 'oversee and sanction'. This changes the power balance. 'Right' implies an entitlement, where 'discretion' implies choice; and 'approve' necessitates an answer, but 'oversee and sanction' is vague and not guaranteed. 'Consent' is replaced with 'sanction', which makes the language unclear. The Licensor is also renamed to Arconic.

perturbation.original_text: Licensee agrees to reasonably cooperate with Licensor in achieving registration of the Licensed Mark worldwide, and in maintaining and protecting existing registrations therefor at Licensor's sole expense. Licensee shall execute any and all documents which Licensor may reasonably request in support of such registrations, and, at Licensor's request, Licensee shall provide use evidence, testimony, and documentation that may be required in any ex parte or inter partes administrative proceedings and prosecutions, maintenance and renewals involving registrations of the Licensed Mark, at Licensee's sole expense.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee agrees to reasonably assist Licensor in achieving registration of the Licensed Mark worldwide, and in upholding and safeguarding existing registrations therefor at Arconic's sole expense. Licensee shall sign any and all papers which Licensor may reasonably require in support of such registrations, and, at Arconic's request, Licensee shall provide use evidence, testimony, and paperwork that may be needed in any ex parte or inter partes administrative proceedings and prosecutions, maintenance and renewals involving registrations of the Licensed Mark, at Licensee's sole out-of-pocket expense.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'cooperate' is replaced with 'assist', 'maintaining and protecting' is replaced with 'upholding and safeguarding', 'documents' is replaced with 'papers' and 'documentation' is replaced with 'paperwork', and 'expense' is replaced with 'out-of-pocket expense'. This causes ambiguity. The Licensor is also renamed to Arconic.
